column4: hey guys and girls can anyone help me setup a local database where I can practice queries? I have my .sql start script i'm just not sure how to build the database
its a script that will help you install ATI or Nvidia drivers
shout1: use synaptic to download envy and use the gui to install your ati driver
shout1: synaptic package manager
shout1: system > administration > synaptic package manager
hey guys i really need to build a local database I can issue queries to.  I have my .sql start script...what else do i need to build the database?
do you have an sql database client/server installed?
i am using mysql-server
alright, get mysql-gui tools, that will give you user/database and query administration
setup a user (if you haven't already
ok i'll try that now
i installed mysql-gui-common.  how do i bring up the gui?
you're in a gui already correct? it should be in the main menu
i can't find it under applications
otherwise, if its not there, you can alt+f2 mysql-admin
the other is exactly that 'mysql-query-browser.
i tried alt+f2 mysql-admin and i got location or could not be found
mysqladmin maybe?
try '/usr/bin/mysql-admin' and '/usr/bin/mysql-query-browser'
hmm..i still can't get a gui.  I can type mysql in the terminal and it brings me to mysql> prompt
i'll try that real quick
ok, that will work
however this is going offtopic... so hang on
